pageContext.claim: “President Obama closed the Iron Range, he closed that whole area. You couldn't do anything...I opened it. Took a lot of heat and from various people, including environmentalists, and I was very proud to take it, and I'll never forget, a man came up to me and said, "Sir, you saved our way of life." And it just -- I still remember it like -- like today, said, "You saved our way of life, by opening up the Iron Range." So, now they're doing fantastically, and I'm very proud of it.”
pageContext.analysis: There are heated disputes over environmental issues along the Iron Range, but it’s a mistake to suggest that it was closed. It's been mined for decades. Tariffs from both President Obama and President Trump have spurred an economic recovery in the area, but experts take the positive outlook with a grain of salt given the volatility in the steel industry.
